title: Police investigating nearly $350K in jewelry thefts for two Trump Tower residents
text:
Police investigating nearly $350K in jewelry thefts for two Trump Tower residents

Police investigating nearly $350K in jewelry thefts for two Trump Tower residents originally appeared on abcnews.go.com

The New York City Police Department is investigating two pricey jewelry thefts from residents of Trump Tower while they were on vacation.

(MORE: Manhunt on for suspects in $4 million New York City jewelry store robbery)

A 33-year-old woman told police that $117,000 in jewelry was stolen when she was away between Sept. 4 and Sept. 10, ABC New York station WABC reported. The item was a Graff diamond bracelet. She lived on the 59th floor, according to The New York Times.

PHOTO: Black limousines pass in front of Trump Tower on Fifth Avenue in New York, New York. (Robert Alexander/Getty Images) More

Another resident, a 69-year-old woman, said about $230,000 in jewelry went missing between June 21 and Sept. 9. This included a Harry Winston diamond bracelet, another bracelet, ring and necklace -- all with diamonds and sapphires -- and a pair of diamond and emerald earrings.

(MORE: Trump to return to Trump Tower for 1st time as president)

The pieces were all in a drawer in her closet on the 42nd floor, according to the Times.

PHOTO: Trump Tower on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, Oct. 18, 2016. (Hiroko Masuike/The New York Times/Redux, FILE) More

Both women said they noticed the jewelry was missing when they returned home from vacation. There was no sign of a break-in at either apartment.

(MORE: Trump Tower climber charged with reckless endangerment, criminal trespass)

It is unclear whether one person is responsible for the thefts or if there is more than one suspect. The NYPD Major Case Squad is investigating.
description: The New York City Police Department is investigating two pricey jewelry thefts from residents of Trump Tower while they were on vacation.  A 33-year-old woman told police that $117,000 in jewelry was stolen when she was away between Sept. 4 and Sept. 10, ABC New York station WABC reported.
